articles.headline: What Happened to Lindsey Graham? He’s Become a Conservative ‘Rock Star’
articles.snippet: Once a fierce critic of President Trump, Senator Lindsey Graham is his close ally. Democrats want “the old Lindsey” back, but he loves the conservative adulation.
articles.abstract: Once a fierce critic of President Trump, Senator Lindsey Graham is his close ally. Democrats want “the old Lindsey” back, but he loves the conservative adulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHESTERFIELD, Mo. — Senator Lindsey Graham’s bipartisan overtures — on immigration, foreign policy, even investigations of President Trump — once made him a darling of Democrats, a Republican dealmaker to be wooed to the center.

articles.headline: Trump Wants to Make it Hard to Get Asylum. Other Countries Feel the Same.
articles.snippet: He may not be the first to flout the rules — even the E.U. has. But he is risking damage that could become permanent.
articles.abstract: He may not be the first to flout the rules — even the E.U. has. But he is risking damage that could become permanent.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — President Trump’s promise to stop a caravan of Central American migrants from reaching the United States border, if necessary through military force, might seem like just another effort by the president to unilaterally dismantle international laws and accepted practices.
articles.byline: By Max Fisher and Amanda Taub

articles.headline: How a Taliban Assassin Got Close Enough to Kill a General
articles.snippet: The attack that killed a powerful Afghan police chief and missed the top U.S. commander led to violence between allies, and the rumor that Americans were behind it all.
articles.abstract: The attack that killed a powerful Afghan police chief and missed the top U.S. commander led to violence between allies, and the rumor that Americans were behind it all.
articles.lead_paragraph: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan — Minutes before killing one of the most important generals in Afghanistan, the infiltrator made a final call to the Taliban.
articles.byline: By Mujib Mashal and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

articles.headline: Mickey Turns 90, and the Disney Marketing Machine Celebrates
articles.snippet: To draw attention to its oldest character, Disney has revved up its cross-promotional machine to what may be its highest level yet.
articles.abstract: To draw attention to its oldest character, Disney has revved up its cross-promotional machine to what may be its highest level yet.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A two-hour prime-time special on ABC. Cupcakes the size of cars at Disneyland Paris. Collaborations with a dozen fashion designers, including Marc Jacobs. More than 30 books, including one from Taschen so big it comes with a carrying handle.

articles.headline: Republicans Have a Humming Economy to Tout, but Trump Rhetoric Muddies the Message
articles.snippet: A glowing jobs report right before an election should be a gift to the party in power, but the president’s strident tone on immigration is drowning out the good news.
articles.abstract: A glowing jobs report right before an election should be a gift to the party in power, but the president’s strident tone on immigration is drowning out the good news.
articles.lead_paragraph: In normal political times, a glowing report on the nation’s economy just before Election Day would be a gift to the party in power and a uniform talking point for its candidates. But entering the final weekend before Tuesday’s midterm vote, President Trump’s blistering message of nativist fear has become the dominant theme of the campaign’s last days, threatening to overshadow the good economic news.
articles.byline: By Astead W. Herndon and Sydney Ember

articles.headline: How the Economic Lives of the Middle Class Have Changed Since 2016, by the Numbers
articles.snippet: Based on a simplified extrapolation, it works out to about $122 gained a month for a typical family — which for some would be wiped out by higher mortgage rates.
articles.abstract: Based on a simplified extrapolation, it works out to about $122 gained a month for a typical family — which for some would be wiped out by higher mortgage rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States economy is the strongest it has been in ages. Growth has been robust, and the unemployment rate is at generational lows, as new data Friday affirmed.

articles.headline: A Nation in Turmoil Prepares to Deliver a Verdict on Trump
articles.snippet: Republicans have grown increasingly pessimistic about holding the House, as polls show a number of incumbents lagging well below 50 percent. G.O.P. leaders are more hopeful about the Senate.
articles.abstract: Republicans have grown increasingly pessimistic about holding the House, as polls show a number of incumbents lagging well below 50 percent. G.O.P. leaders are more hopeful about the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS LUNAS, N.M. — The tumultuous 2018 midterm campaign, shaped by conflicts over race and identity and punctuated by tragedy, barreled through its final weekend as voters prepared to deliver a verdict on the first half of President Trump’s term, with Republicans bracing for losses in the House and state capitals but hopeful they would prevail in Senate races in areas where Mr. Trump is popular.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Anguished by ‘Spiral of Hate,’ Charleston Pastor and Pittsburgh Rabbi Grieve as One
articles.snippet: The killings of nine parishioners at a black church in Charleston and 11 congregants at a synagogue in Pittsburgh brought people in those two communities together in an unspeakable grief.
articles.abstract: The killings of nine parishioners at a black church in Charleston and 11 congregants at a synagogue in Pittsburgh brought people in those two communities together in an unspeakable grief.
articles.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH — An African Methodist pastor, dressed in a dark suit and white clerical collar, greeted a Conservative rabbi, wearing a black overcoat and matching fedora, in the lobby of a downtown hotel on Friday morning. They spread their arms wide and embraced at length, the rabbi patting the pastor rhythmically on the back as the pastor drew him close. Words were not necessary.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Sees Trump’s Playbook as Best Hope in Some Tight Races
articles.snippet: Some candidates are following the president in attacking prominent liberals and minorities to stoke an us vs. them narrative about the country’s security and culture.
articles.abstract: Some candidates are following the president in attacking prominent liberals and minorities to stoke an us vs. them narrative about the country’s security and culture.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALBERT LEA, Minn. — The Republican attack ads targeting George Soros and Colin Kaepernick were the first to arrive in southern Minnesota last month, so closely echoing President Trump that he could have written them himself.

articles.headline: Trump Administration Spares Corporate Wrongdoers Billions in Penalties
articles.snippet: Punishment of banks and big companies accused of malfeasance has declined precipitously since the Obama era.
articles.abstract: Punishment of banks and big companies accused of malfeasance has declined precipitously since the Obama era.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the final months of the Obama administration, Walmart was under pressure from federal officials to pay nearly $1 billion and accept a guilty plea to resolve a foreign bribery investigation.
articles.byline: By Ben Protess, Robert Gebeloff and Danielle Ivory

articles.headline: Searching for the Next Bobby Fischer, the U.S. Finds Fabi
articles.snippet: Fabiano Caruana, 26, has dedicated much of his young life to chess. This month’s world championships could be the moment all those games pay off.
articles.abstract: Fabiano Caruana, 26, has dedicated much of his young life to chess. This month’s world championships could be the moment all those games pay off.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last American to win the world chess championship was a Brooklyn-bred grandmaster who stunned the world champion and took his title.

articles.headline: Consulting Firms Keep Lucrative Saudi Alliance, Shaping Crown Prince’s Vision
articles.snippet: McKinsey, Booz Allen Hamilton and Boston Consulting have all continued work with the kingdom even as investors distance themselves after the murder of the journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
articles.abstract: McKinsey, Booz Allen Hamilton and Boston Consulting have all continued work with the kingdom even as investors distance themselves after the murder of the journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia charmed Goldman Sachs bankers and Silicon Valley executives on an American tour this spring, some of his most trusted lieutenants were taking care of business in Washington.
articles.byline: By Michael Forsythe, Mark Mazzetti, Ben Hubbard and Walt Bogdanich

articles.headline: Inside the Trump Administration’s Fight to Add a Citizenship Question to the Census
articles.snippet: The census determines how political districts are mapped — and many immigrants are already saying they won’t participate if asked about citizenship.
articles.abstract: The census determines how political districts are mapped — and many immigrants are already saying they won’t participate if asked about citizenship.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Wilbur L. Ross Jr. had been Commerce secretary for less than three months, and he was growing impatient.

articles.headline: As Nigerian Fashion Booms, Women Lead Its Coverage
articles.snippet: Spurred by the leadership of entrepreneurial women and Nigeria’s cultural cachet around Africa and the world, the country’s fashion magazine industry has found a receptive audience.
articles.abstract: Spurred by the leadership of entrepreneurial women and Nigeria’s cultural cachet around Africa and the world, the country’s fashion magazine industry has found a receptive audience.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s not easy running a fashion magazine in Nigeria.

articles.headline: Brian Kemp’s Office, Without Citing Evidence, Investigates Georgia Democrats Over Alleged ‘Hack’
articles.snippet: The office of Mr. Kemp, the Republican nominee for governor, said it had notified the F.B.I. about the inquiry. Democrats called it a political stunt.
articles.abstract: The office of Mr. Kemp, the Republican nominee for governor, said it had notified the F.B.I. about the inquiry. Democrats called it a political stunt.
articles.lead_paragraph: • Candidates are making a final pitch to voters across the United States.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Two Capitals, One Russian Oligarch: How Oleg Deripaska Is Trying to Escape U.S. Sanctions
articles.snippet: Mr. Deripaska has spent millions building influence in Washington and London. Now he awaits a key decision from the Trump administration.
articles.abstract: Mr. Deripaska has spent millions building influence in Washington and London. Now he awaits a key decision from the Trump administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: This spring, a British lord with deep ties to the governing Conservative Party and a reputation as a do-gooder environmentalist arrived in Washington on an unlikely mission: to save the business empire of Oleg Deripaska, one of Russia’s most infamous oligarchs.
articles.byline: By Andrew Higgins and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: Far-Right Internet Groups Listen for Trump’s Approval, and Often Hear It
articles.snippet: In recent weeks, extremist internet communities have cheered as their once-fringe views have found oxygen among prominent Republicans.
articles.abstract: In recent weeks, extremist internet communities have cheered as their once-fringe views have found oxygen among prominent Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, minutes after President Trump posted an incendiary campaign ad falsely accusing Democrats of flooding the country with murderous illegal immigrants, virulent racists on an online message board erupted in celebration.
articles.byline: By Kevin Roose and Ali Winston

articles.headline: Another Trump Scoop, a Giddy Reaction and a Reporter Under Fire
articles.snippet: The Axios reporter Jonathan Swan has been behind several major scoops in Washington media circles but he has been criticized for favoring access over accountability.
articles.abstract: The Axios reporter Jonathan Swan has been behind several major scoops in Washington media circles but he has been criticized for favoring access over accountability.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jonathan Swan could not sleep.

articles.headline: Booksellers Protest Amazon Site’s Move to Drop Stores From Certain Countries
articles.snippet: A flash strike against AbeBooks, which began Monday, is a rare concerted action by vendors against any part of Amazon, which wields huge power in the book world.
articles.abstract: A flash strike against AbeBooks, which began Monday, is a rare concerted action by vendors against any part of Amazon, which wields huge power in the book world.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — More than 450 antiquarian book dealers in at least 26 countries pulled their books off an Amazon subsidiary on Monday, an impromptu protest after the site abruptly said it would drop all sellers from several nations.

articles.headline: You ‘Approved This Message’? Seriously?
articles.snippet: The “Stand By Your Ad” rule, created in 2002, was meant to keep candidates from airing nasty ads. In the Trump era, it seems like a quaint relic.
articles.abstract: The “Stand By Your Ad” rule, created in 2002, was meant to keep candidates from airing nasty ads. In the Trump era, it seems like a quaint relic.
articles.lead_paragraph: DELRAY BEACH, Fla. — Let me take you back to a time when Democrats and Republicans could breathe the same air without choking on it.

articles.headline: Brent Taylor, Utah Mayor Killed in Afghanistan, Was on 4th Deployment
articles.snippet: Major Taylor, who died Saturday in an apparent insider attack, was helping train Afghan troops and staying in touch with his North Ogden constituents on social media.
articles.abstract: Major Taylor, who died Saturday in an apparent insider attack, was helping train Afghan troops and staying in touch with his North Ogden constituents on social media.
articles.lead_paragraph: NORTH OGDEN, Utah — The call had come again. Brent Taylor, the mayor of North Ogden and a major in the Utah National Guard, would be going to Afghanistan for his fourth deployment.

articles.headline: China Seeks Allies as Trump’s Trade War Mounts. It Won’t Be Easy.
articles.snippet: President Xi Jinping kicks off a Shanghai event showing a growing Chinese appetite to buy from the rest of the world. Even critics of the U.S. have doubts.
articles.abstract: President Xi Jinping kicks off a Shanghai event showing a growing Chinese appetite to buy from the rest of the world. Even critics of the U.S. have doubts.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Faced with mounting American tariffs that could slow China’s already weakened economy, President Xi Jinping is pressing the case to the rest of the world that China can be a positive force for global trade.

articles.headline: Even Fox News Stops Running Trump Caravan Ad Criticized as Racist
articles.snippet: NBC and Facebook also pulled the ad, which was intended to stir fear of migrants moving north through Mexico. CNN rejected it, calling the ad “racist.”
articles.abstract: NBC and Facebook also pulled the ad, which was intended to stir fear of migrants moving north through Mexico. CNN rejected it, calling the ad “racist.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Major television networks and Facebook have taken the unusual step of rejecting an inflammatory ad by President Trump’s political team that effectively closes a fiercely fought midterm campaign with a message portraying immigrants as a violent threat.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and Niraj Chokshi

articles.headline: Their Soybeans Piling Up, Farmers Hope Trade War Ends Before Beans Rot
articles.snippet: North Dakota’s soybean crops are flourishing. But China has stopped buying.
articles.abstract: North Dakota’s soybean crops are flourishing. But China has stopped buying.
articles.lead_paragraph: ARTHUR, N.D. — This is harvest season in the rich farmlands of the eastern Dakotas, the time of year Kevin Karel checks his computer first thing in the morning to see how many of his soybeans Chinese companies have purchased while he was sleeping.
